questions.question_text:
A storage administrator notices an increasing number of storage targets that unexpectedly reach capacity, causing periodic service interruptions. The administrator must now create and submit a daily report of the environment that shows the status of the storage targets with the highest capacities.

Which solution provides this information?

choices.A: Cisco Intersight with Slow Drain Analysis

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
I will go with C. Cisco DCNM with SAN Insights

Per my understanding Slow Drain Analysis is a part of SAN Insights which is part of DCNM, and I doubt that cisco would write about Nagios in this situation hence C.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/sw/11_4_1/videos/slow-drain-analysis-with-san.html

Selected Answer: C
[C] seems more appropriate

the answer is correct.
SNMP
CLI-based scripts

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP
-

Drag and drop the mechanisms to collect data from a network from the left onto their characteristics on the right.

//IMG//

//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer needs to implement a monitoring session that should meet the following requirements:
✑ Monitor traffic from leaf to leaf switches on a Cisco ACI network
✑ Support filtering traffic from Bridge Domain or VRF
Which configuration must be added to meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
It's correct (D) but the answer is incomplete.
The full command is "filter tenant t1 application app1 epg epg1" and it needs to be added under "source interface eth 1/1 switch 101"

comments.content: Thanks, it makes much more sense now.

discussion.content:
Question makes no sense. ERSPAN can be configured as Access, Fabric or Tenant.

Fabric ERSPAN configuration does not require appplication app1 epg egp1.
Access ERSPAN configuration however requires filter tenant tenant-name application application-name epg epg-name.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/aci/apic/sw/4-x/cli-configuration/Cisco-APIC-NX-OS-Style-CLI-Configuration-Guide-401/Cisco-APIC-NX-OS-Style-CLI-Configuration-Guide-401_chapter_010100.html#task_E4E78972BA924CE19DB08421CA117B88

Selected Answer: D
D is correct
filter tenant t1 application app1 epg epg1 is the complete command

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. SVR-A in EPG-A/BD-A fails to reach SVR-B in EPG-B/BD-B. Which two conditions should be verified to analyze the traffic between the two EPGs? (Choose two.)

choices.B: The bridge domain for EPG-B floods ARP packets.
choices.D: Limit Endpoint Learning is disabled on the bridge domain for EPG-B.
choices.A: A contract exists between EPG-A and EPG-B and allows the traffic.
choices.E: SVR-B is learned as an endpoint in EPG-B from Node-112.
choices.C: EPG-A and EPG-B are excluded from the preferred group.

comments.content: this reasoning is wrong, eth1/2 is the one to be standby and not 1/3

discussion.content: I think priority of second port shoult be 65534. This will cause first interface with default priority of 32768 to have lower LACP interface ID and ensure, that from these two interfaces, this will be the active interface responsible for active ngotiation. so "priority 65534" for eth 1/3.
Lower the number is higher the priority. So, with given answer 1/2 act as hot standby with default value 32768 and 1/3 act as active with priority 1
Answer is correct, lacp-prio 1 as eth1/2 is supposed to be standby port (hence default priority 32768), which causes eth1/3 to be selected as active

It is correct
Higher Priority Number = Lower Interface Priority

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/nexus9000/sw/6-x/interfaces/configuration/guide/b_Cisco_Nexus_9000_Series_NX-OS_Interfaces_Configuration_Guide/b_Cisco_Nexus_9000_Series_NX-OS_Interfaces_Configuration_Guide_chapter_0110.html#task_8FA71B7F1748420293D930A5239B2E20:~:text=Configures%20the%20port%20priority%20for%20use%20with%20LACP.%20Valid%20values%20are%20from%201%20through%2065535%2C%20and%20higher%20numbers%20have%20a%20lower%20priority.%20The%20default%20value%20is%2032768.

An engineer must configure an LACP port channel on two Cisco Nexus 9000 Series Switches. The interface e1/2 must be a hot-standby link that initiates negotiation with other ports. Drag and drop the commands from the right onto the blanks in the configuration on the left. Not all commands are used.

//IMG//
